category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 26 (Appointment of Directors and Auditors)
contents: Article 26 (Appointment of Directors and Auditors) ① Directors (excluding the President, International Olympic Committee members, Secretary-General and athlete representatives; hereinafter the same shall apply in this Article) are appointed at the general meeting from among those recommended by the President. However, the appointment authority may be delegated to the president by resolution of the general meeting, and in this case, the appointment results must be reported to the next general meeting., ② The secretary general is appointed by the president with the consent of the board of directors., ③ The player representative is Article 42. In accordance with Article 5, he/she must be elected by the Athletes' Committee and approved by the General Assembly. However, the approval authority at the general meeting can be delegated to the president, in which case the appointment results must be reported to the next general meeting. Revised on March 16, 2021, ④ When forming the board of directors, the majority of registered directors must be directors representing member sports organizations that have joined the International Federation of Olympic Sports. In this case, for Olympic sports, the Olympic Games held immediately after the general meeting of officers are elected. It is based on ⑤ Directors under paragraph 4 shall be appointed upon recommendation from the relevant member sport organization, but the standards and procedures shall be determined separately. Newly established on March 13, 2019, ⑥ When forming the board of directors, a variety of personnel should be allowed to participate in consideration of expertise and representativeness, but efforts should be made to ensure that the ratio of specific genders does not exceed 70%. Revised October 13, 2020, ⑦ When there is a vacancy in the position of a director, the person recommended by the chairman shall be elected by the board of directors, and this shall be reported to the next general meeting., ⑧ The auditor shall be appointed at the general meeting, but shall be appointed from among the delegates who are representatives of regular member organizations. Two auditors (one representative each from member sports organizations and member city/provincial sports associations) and one accounting auditor are appointed from among those qualified as certified public accountants. Revised 2018. 4. 2., 2021. 7. 5., ⑨ Deleted 2018. 4. 2.
